job_title: Physical Education Teacher (PE Teacher) in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Often times but a bad place to work but still has the common problems with salaries as any other job.
cons: People here are oblivious to the problems most will face when working at Prin. The motto is give until you can't without any extra compensation.

pros: The people you get to work with are incredible - inspiring, collaborative, loving, happy, and highly talented. The benefits package was extremely generous including tuition for my kids and tuition reimbursement for my grad school. World class in-house professional development and generous funding to go to outside PD. The school covers teacher supplies and has support for tech, curriculum development, and more. Teachers love the students.
cons: Teachers are expected to do a lot besides teaching like curriculum development, weeks of PD before school starts, advisory and chaperoning student trips, but at least it is well supported with training and funding and can be very personally rewarding.

pros: Growing, innovating, learning, professional development, endowment
cons: growing pains, small, we need teachers with stamina

job_title: Full Time Faculty in Saint Louis, MO

pros: Lots of opportunities for recent grads to get some real world work experience under their belts. Great benefits including time off and 401k matching up to 7.5%. Supportive community.
cons: Minimal opportunity for promotions within your department. A lot of employees who are hired here stay here for decades. It seems like it could take 10-12 years for a substantial promotion. Small community where it seems like everyone is in your business.

job_title: Alumni Officer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Most departments have few people, so you get to be a great general manager, a jack of all trades and a master of none so to speak. This experience stacks up and exceeds many corporate positions early on in one's career, as many of many counterparts had limited scope of responsibility, but a lot of it.
cons: Outside of being a teacher or professor, there was a limited path to career advancement, and most people work on the staff because other family members do, or so they can be close to their children.

job_title: High School English Teacher in Saint Louis, MO

A move towards innovative education that is meaningful for any and all 21st Century youth.
A focus on educating leaders to solve problems through thinking with Principle, Truth.
A focus on developing young men and women to be strong citizens who contribute to the public good.
cons:
Salaries - feel like they are hidden and impossible to impact.
Busy-ness - feels like more and more is added without any further compensation.
